mixed-models

Oliver Jayasinghe and Rex Parsons

Source: vignettes/mixed-models.Rmd
mixed-models.Rmd
library(GLMMcosinor)
data(vitamind)

GLMMcossinor allows specification of mixed models accounting for fixed and/or random effects. Mixed model specification follows the lme4 format. See Fitting Linear Mixed-Effects Models Using lme4 for details about how to specify mixed models.

To add a random effects term to the intercept of the vitamind model, we can add a (1|amp_acro1) term to the formula, after the amp_acro() function. amp_acro1 indicates that the random effect is the first (and only) component of the model.

n_components = 1,
group = "X",
period = 12
) + (1|amp_acro1), data = vitamind)

obj

If the model has two components, but we only wish to add a random effect to the second one, we would specify:

obj <- cosinor.glmm(Y ~ X + amp_acro(time,
n_components = 2,
group = "X",
period = c(12,8)
) + (1|amp_acro2), data = vitamind)
#> Warning in checkMatrixPackageVersion(): Package version inconsistency detected.
#> TMB was built with Matrix version 1.5.4.1
#> Current Matrix version is 1.5.4
#> Please re-install 'TMB' from source using install.packages('TMB', type = 'source') or ask CRAN for a binary version of 'TMB' matching CRAN's 'Matrix' package

obj

#> [X=0]:acr2   1.60306
#> [X=1]:acr2   2.77115

Alternatively, we could assign random effects to both components:

obj <- cosinor.glmm(Y ~ X + amp_acro(time,
n_components = 2,
group = "X",
period = c(12,8)
) + (1|amp_acro1) + (1|amp_acro2), data = vitamind)

obj
#> 
#>  Conditional Model 
#> 
#>  Raw formula: 
#> Y ~ X + X:main_rrr1 + X:main_sss1 + X:main_rrr2 + X:main_sss2 +      (1 | main_rrr1 + main_sss1) + (1 | main_rrr2 + main_sss2) 
#> 
#>  Raw Coefficients: 
#>              Estimate
#> (Intercept)  29.98311
#> X1            1.72716
#> X0:main_rrr1  2.13805
#> X1:main_rrr1  6.77127
#> X0:main_sss1  6.15240
#> X1:main_sss1  4.33057
#> X0:main_rrr2 -0.05000
#> X1:main_rrr2 -0.93677
#> X0:main_sss2 -1.54878
#> X1:main_sss2 -0.36382
#> 
#>  Transformed Coefficients: 
#>             Estimate
#> (Intercept) 29.98311
#> [X=1]        1.72716
#> [X=0]:amp1   6.51332
#> [X=1]:amp1   8.03766
#> [X=0]:amp2   1.54959
#> [X=1]:amp2   1.00494
#> [X=0]:acr1  -1.23634
#> [X=1]:acr1  -0.56899
#> [X=0]:acr2   1.60307
#> [X=1]:acr2   2.77115

We could also assign random effects to the group:

obj <- cosinor.glmm(Y ~ X + amp_acro(time,
n_components = 1,
group = "X",
period = 12
) + (1|X), data = vitamind)

obj
#> 
#>  Conditional Model 
#> 
#>  Raw formula: 
#> Y ~ X + X:main_rrr1 + X:main_sss1 + (1 | X) 
#>

#> (Intercept)  29.68979

#> X0:main_rrr1  0.93079

#> X0:main_sss1  6.20099
#> X1:main_sss1  4.81846
